profile.name: King Deva
profile.title: King Deva
profile.subtitle: King Deva build on the philosophy the Vedas.
profile.describe: A King, who has received according to the rule the sacrament prescribed by the Veda, must duly protect this whole world. A King who, while he protects his people, is defied by foes, be they equal in strength, or stronger, or weaker, must not shrink from battle, remembering the duty of Kings. Not to turn back in battle, to protect the people, to honour the Brahmanas, is the best means for a King to secure happiness. But the King who is conquered in battle, while he turns back in fear, takes upon himself all the sin of his master, whatever it may be. The highest duty of a King is to protect the people, for the King who enjoys the rewards, just mentioned, is bound to discharge that duty.
profile.post: Kings who are desirous to gain merit and praise if they imitate the practice of virtuous men without reciting sacred texts.
profile.style: A King painter and modern style.
profile.creator: Quinn Michaels

laws: A king who does not afford protection, (yet) takes his share in kind, his taxes, tolls and duties, daily presents and fines, will (after death) soon sink into hell.
After (due) consideration the king shall always fix in his realm the duties and taxes in such a manner that both he himself and the man who does the work receive (their due) reward.
As the leech, the calf, and the bee take their food little by little, even so must the king draw from his realm moderate annual taxes.
